result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron S Schneider

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear, received and filed in court.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   
Defendant Aaron S Schneider did not appear.    
Attorney appeared by authorization.

Defendant is currently engaged in treatment.
  Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:58 PM Defendant Aaron S Schneider in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A appears by Zoom. 

Defense is seeking a bail modification to no violent contact.  State indicates the victim is requesting the modification and would defer to the victim.  Court conducts colloquy with Victim A - who confirms the desire to modify to no violent contact.    The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Letter filed by the State requesting the victim be allowed to appear by Zoom.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/6/2022 - Approved.**
Hearing on May 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   
Defendant Aaron S Schneider did not appear.    
Court to Address:  Defense Motion for Bail Modification (No Contact with Victim be Converted to No Violent Contact with Victim).
Case scheduled for 10:30 am. and Matter called @ 10:49 am.

Based on the non-appearance by the defendant - Court takes no action on the bail motion.
Bail/bond hearing on April 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond
Hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Amended to a Signature Bond. Refund bond to poster

ADDRESS INFO for Aaron S Schneider
Current: 2643 N 73rd Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53213 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2022)
Prior: 2643 N. 73rd St., Wauwatosa, WI 53210 United States

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant can have 3rd party contact through the defendant's mother for placement issues only.

08:59 AM Defendant Aaron S Schneider in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant can bring back the issue of no contact condition before this court.  Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
